Pre-Game Insights: Denmark will welcome Switzerland to Parken Stadium in the group stage of the UEFA Nations League on Thursday.
Denmark suffered their first loss of the year in their previous outing, losing 2-0 to Germany in the UEFA Euro 2024 round of 16 in June.
Switzerland met England in the quarterfinals of Euro 2024 and, after the scoreline ended 1-1 after extra time, they suffered a 5-3 loss in the penalty shootout.
Denmark and Switzerland have contested 13 meetings closely with seven games ending in draws and Denmark leading 4-2 in wins.
Denmark are unbeaten in their last six meetings against Switzerland, keeping three clean sheets.
Eight of the last 10 meetings between Denmark and Switzerland have produced under 2.5 goals.
Denmark have seen conclusive results in their last 10 games in the Nations League, with seven wins and three losses.
Switzerland have seen conclusive results in their last seven games in the Nations League, with four wins, and have won their last three games in the competition.
Denmark are winless in their last four games, failing to score in the last two.
Denmark are unbeaten in their last 11 home games in all competitions, keeping six clean sheets, and have an unbeaten home record against Switzerland.
Switzerland have lost just two of the last 19 games in all competitions, with one of them coming on penalties against England in July.
Switzerland have won just one of their last seven away games in the Nations League.
Fabian Schär announced his retirement last week following Xherdan Shaqiri and Yann Sommer, who retired after Euro 2024.
Becir Omeragic, Filip Ugrinic, Joël Monteiro, Uran Bislimi, Jonas Omlin, and Dominik Schmid are back in the national team while Gregory Wüthrich is named to the national team for the first time.
Considering the current form of the two teams and recent history, a draw will likely ensue.
